description: Comprehensive high school economics course covering foundational concepts, production, trade, market structures, labour, national income, inflation, and fiscal policy.

topics.name: Unit 1: Introduction & Basic Concepts
topics.description: Basic economic concepts, scarcity, opportunity cost, resources, needs vs wants, and the role of economics in society

topics.name: Unit 2: Production & Trade
topics.description: Factors of production, specialization, comparative advantage, trade benefits, and international trade basics

topics.name: Unit 3: Demand and Supply
topics.description: Law of demand, law of supply, market equilibrium, shifts vs movements, and determinants of demand and supply

topics.name: Unit 4: Elasticity
topics.description: Price elasticity of demand and supply, income elasticity, cross elasticity, calculation methods, and applications

topics.name: Unit 5: Production and Costs
topics.description: Short-run and long-run production, costs of production, economies of scale, and cost curves analysis

topics.name: Unit 6: Market Structures
topics.description: Perfect competition, monopoly, monopolistic competition, oligopoly, characteristics, pricing, and output decisions

topics.name: Unit 7: Labour Market
topics.description: Labour demand and supply, wage determination, unions, minimum wage, and government interventions

topics.name: Unit 8: National Income & Circular Flow
topics.description: Concepts of GDP, GNP, national income accounting, circular flow model, and leakages/injections

topics.name: Unit 9: Employment & Inflation
topics.description: Types of unemployment, inflation causes and effects, Phillips curve, and policies to manage employment and inflation

topics.name: Unit 10: Government Fiscal Policy
topics.description: Government revenue, taxation, expenditure, budget balance, fiscal stimulus, and policy impacts on economy
